intro: Camelina glabrata, commonly known as smooth camelina, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has simple, alternate leaves that are linear to ovate in shape. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the summer months. Camelina glabrata is known for its ability to thrive in dry, disturbed soils and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
